name: omi UMa
scenarioDescription:
The omi UMa Exoplanetary System

omi UMa is a star with 3.09 times the mass of the Sun, and 14.1 times its radius. It is located 197.32 light years away from the solar system.

omi UMa is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

omi UMa b

omi UMa b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-12. Its semi-major axis is 3.90 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 1630.00 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, omi UMa.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.13, which means that when omi UMa b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 3.39 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 4.41. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of omi UMa b is 1303.02 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, omi UMa b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system omi UMa, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
